event.title: was founded by Arthur Edward Stilwell during the building of the Kansas City, Pittsburg and Gulf Railroad (now

data.event: Mena was founded by Arthur Edward Stilwell during the building of the Kansas City, Pittsburg and Gulf Railroad (now the Kansas City Southern), which stretched from Kansas City, Missouri to Port Arthur, Texas.
Train service to Mena began in 1896.

event.title: named the town in honor of Folmina Margaretha Janssen-De Goeijen, the wife of his friend and financier Jan

data.event: Stilwell named the town in honor of Folmina Margaretha Janssen-De Goeijen, the wife of his friend and financier Jan De Goeijen, whom Mr. De Goeijen affectionately called Mena.
Mena was settled in 1896, and incorporated on September 18, 1896.
Mena was settled in 1896, and incorporated on September 18, 1896.

event.title: 1897, the Bank of Mena was founded

data.event: In 1897, the Bank of Mena was founded.

event.title: The following year, the county seat was moved

data.event: The following year, the county seat was moved from nearby Dallas, Arkansas to Mena.
Mena's population had grown to 3,423 by 1900.
